title: NAV buttons
body: The Calculate NAV button initiates NAV calculation and acceptance for one or several funds you choose from the list. If you choose several funds, NAV for these funds is calculated one by one.

title: NAV buttons
body: The Accept NAV button initiates NAV acceptance for one or several funds you choose the list.

title: Questions about the List of funds
body: I set a share class status "passive" in FA Back. Why is it still shown in the funds list?

title: Questions about the List of funds
body: The list shows all fund’s share classes, regardless, for example, of their status.

title: Questions about the List of funds
body: I can't see the fund group selection. Why?

title: Questions about the List of funds
body: This means that you have only one group defined in FA Back or that you have permissions to view only one group of funds.

title: Fund reporting view
body: The Fund reporting view lets you preview, check and accept fund statistics, such as fund KPIs and fund holdings. Fund reporting is set up in the Portfolio window, Fund settings tab in the FA Back.

title: List of funds
body: List of funds

title: Calculation statuses
body: The calculation status indicates if you should calculate the reporting data today:

title: Calculation statuses
body: No schedule

title: Calculation statuses
body: The calculation schedule is missing in the fund settings. The schedule is set in the Fund wizard (see Fund wizard).

title: Calculation statuses
body: No action

title: Calculation statuses
body: No calculation or acceptance needs to be carried out today. All calculations are scheduled for the future.

title: Calculation statuses
body: Pending

title: Calculation statuses
body: Reporting data needs to be calculated today. If you didn’t calculate the reporting data for the previous scheduled days, you need to calculate and accept these first to be able to calculate the current day’s reporting data.

title: Calculation statuses
body: Calculated

title: Calculation statuses
body: Reporting data was already calculated, and you can accept it.

title: Calculation statuses
body: Accepted

title: Calculation statuses
body: Reporting data was accepted today. The next calculation date is in the future.

title: Mass-calculation buttons
body: To calculate or accept the data for several funds, choose the funds and click one of the buttons at the top of the list:

title: Mass-calculation buttons
body: Calculate

title: Mass-calculation buttons
body: Update the fund reporting data based on the latest fund and NAV information.

title: Mass-calculation buttons

title: KPI tabs
body: KPI tabs show fund portfolio analyzed as a whole and by share class. The indicators are:

title: KPI tabs

title: KPI tabs

title: Performance tab
body: The Performance tab shows the fund portfolio performance since the fund inception as a graph.

title: FA audit logs
body: FA audit logs let you track user activities related to sensitive customer data and changes in preferences that can modify the business logic.

title: Customer information logs
body: FA records logging in and out, opening windows, making selections on Overview, searches, report generations, PDF and XLS exports. Each audit trail entry includes details about the user, time, and screen, and information the user accessed or exported.

title: Logged from FA Fund Management
body: Logged from FA Fund Management

title: Changes in system settings
body: FA tracks changes in system settings that can affect FA functionality and system logic.

title: File management view
body: The File management view allows you to access system-level files and troubleshoot file-based integrations, FA Back and FA Front configurations, and themes.

title: Folders list
body: File management view provides you access to the following folders:

title: Folders list
body: fa-back – Files received and generated for file-based integrations.

title: Folders list
body: keycloak-custom-themes – Custom login page themes.

title: Folders list
body: keycloak-custom-spi – Extensions for authentication, for example against in-house identity provider (JAR files).

title: Folders list
body: routes – Routes for client-specific integrations with the FA Connector microservice.

title: Folder details pane
body: The details pane on the right shows the file or folder information and lets you open a folder, download a file, rename, copy, move or delete. To open the details pane, double-click a folder or a file from the list.

title: File management buttons
body: To upload a file or create a new folder, use the buttons at the top. The total size limit for files and folders to upload is 500MB per upload.

title: File management buttons
body: To rename, copy or move files or folders, select them from the list and click . Note that if a folder with the same name but different content exists at the destination, the Replace all option in the dialog doesn't remove it. Instead, it merges the content of the folder you are moving into the existing one.

title: File management buttons
body: To download multiple files or folders, select them from the list and click . Multiple files are downloaded in a ZIP folder.

title: File management buttons
body: To delete multiple files, select them from the list and click .

title: User access
body: Follow the instructions below to set up access to FA Client Portal:

title: User access
body: Access for end users - Create a user and specify contacts and portfolios the user can access.

title: User access
body: Access for troubleshooting - Set up view-only access to client information for advisors, support service, and so on.

title: Access for end users
body: FA Client Portal provides end clients with access to investment information. The user can access:

title: Access for end users
body: Their own portfolios and subportfolios.

title: Access for end users
body: Portfolios and subportfolios of the contacts the user represents – for example, if the user represents their child or a company they work for. A representative can switch between the contacts in FA Client Portal by clicking .

title: Access for end users
body: To provide access to FA Client Portal, you need to:

title: Access for end users
body: Add a new user as described in Managing users in FA Admin guide. Assign the user CLIENT PORTAL role.

title: Access for end users
body: Set up the user’s access to client information stored in FA Back:

title: Access for end users
body: To let the user access their own investment information, make sure the user's contact is specified as a primary contact for the portfolio (see Portfolio window) and link this contact to the user in FA Admin console (to do this, follow the steps in Link a contact to the user).

title: Access for end users
body: To let a representative access the linked contacts’ information in FA Client Portal, add the user as the contact’s representative in the Contact window, Representatives tab.

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: Access for troubleshooting

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: View-only mode lets advisors and support service specialists access the same view as the client sees, without being able to make any modifications. To access client accounts in FA Client Portal view-only:

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: Assign your user "CLIENT PORTAL IMPERSONATE" role in FA Admin Console. See Assign user roles for detailed instructions.

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: View FA Client Portal for a contact in the impersonate mode using one of the methods:

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: In FA Back, right-click the contact in the Overview and choose "Impersonate in Client Portal".

title: Access for troubleshooting
body: Open your browser and enter the link https://<instance>.fasolutions.com/public/myinvestments/impersonate/<client's contact database ID>/.

title: Overview
body: Overview provides a quick glance at the client’s assets, profit, and available cash. The user can view aggregated data from all portfolios or for a chosen portfolio.

title: Total investments (all portfolios)
body: If the user chooses Total investments at the top, the app shows Current market value and Unrealised profits from all portfolios (including subportfolios) and a short summary for each portfolio. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the summary shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Portfolio investments
body: If the user chooses a portfolio at the top, the app shows investment information for the chosen portfolio:

title: Portfolio investments

title: Orders view
body: The Orders view shows the client’s trade orders. The user can view the list of orders in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Orders view shows orders from subportfolios as well. Orders can be filtered by transaction date, order type, and security.

title: Orders view
body: Orders in the list are grouped by status (Open, Accepted, In execution, Cancelled). For each order in the list, the user can view security name, portfolio name, transaction date, units, order type, and trade amount.

title: Canceling an order
body: The user can cancel an order in Open or Accepted status by clicking the icon. To make this option available for the user, add the portfolio to the portfolio group CP_CANCEL in FA Back.

If there is no transaction confirmation generated in FA Back, the document is generated on the fly. On-the-fly generation requires a custom JSReport transaction confirmation report installed. For details, see Transaction confirmation report (PDF) .

title: Trading view
body: The Trading view allows users to browse securities on the markets and create buy trade orders. Securities in the list are grouped by security type. The user can filter securities by Country and Security type and search by Security name.

title: Trading view
body: To provide access to the Trading view, add the user's portfolio in the CP_TRADING portfolio group in FA Back (for details about portfolio groups, see Portfolio groups in FA Back reference).

title: Trading view
body: Trade orders are imported to FA Back and can be further processed there and sent to a marketplace.

title: Security details
body: Security details show security information and display recent price change as a graph. The user can view:

title: Security details

title: Security details

title: Security details
body: Buy and/or Sell buttons. To enable buying and selling options for a security, you need to add a "Tradeable" tag to this security in FA Back.

title: Security details
body: Documents (prospectus and KIID). To make the documents available to the user, navigate to the Security window in FA Back and input the prospectus and KIID URLs in the URL and URL 2 fields. Make sure the URLs begin with a valid protocol (http://, https:// or ftp://) or they will not be visible to the user in the FA Client Portal.

To change this, go to the Security window in FA Back and choose one or more options in the Trade type field: "Buy units", "Buy trade amount", "Sell units", "Sell trade amount".

The user can view the list of securities in all portfolios or in a portfolio chosen in the drop-down at the top. If a portfolio has subportfolios, the Holdings view shows values aggregated from subportfolios.

title: Monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The user can set up monthly investments to buy securities regularly. The user specifies which securities to buy, the amount to spend, and defines the schedule. After that, FA automatically creates trade orders for the user based on the entered information.

title: Enable monthly investments in FA Back
body: To enable monthly savings functionality in FA Back:

title: Enable monthly investments in FA Back
body: Follow the Set up monthly investments instructions in FA Admin guide to define the trade order generation details.

title: Enable monthly investments in FA Back
body: To enable monthly investment functionality for the user, include the client's portfolios in the CP_MONTHLYINVESTMENTS portfolio group. The user can set up monthly investments only for portfolios included in the CP_MONTHLYINVESTMENTS portfolio group.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: To define the monthly investments in FA Client Portal, the user chooses Monthly investments in the top-right menu and fills in the following information:

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: Portfolio section

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Portfolio section lets the user choose the investment portfolio and the amount to invest in the portfolio currency. The portfolio selection shows only portfolios included in the CP_MONTHLYINVESTMENTS portfolio group.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: You can define a minimum monthly investment per portfolio by adding portfolio key figure CP_MI_MIN_AMOUNT in FA Back.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: Security section

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Security section lets the user search and choose the securities to invest in. The list shows securities with the Tradeable tag. The user can search by security name or ISIN, and select the security from the results list below.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: Investment distribution section

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Investment distribution section lets the user define the percentage or amount to invest in each security. The entered percentage or amount must take into account the minimum trade amount shown for each security (it is fetched from the security's Minimum trade amount fields in the Cost info tab).

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Distribute evenly button divides the investment amount evenly between the chosen securities.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: Investment schedule section

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Investment schedule section lets the user define the months and dates to generate trade orders for.

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: Summary section

title: Set up monthly investments in FA Client Portal
body: The Summary section provides an overview of the monthly investments settings and lets the user confirm the choices they made.

title: Data modifications view
body: The Data modifications view covers all applications that modify the core data of the platform (contacts, portfolios, customers, transactions, trade orders, and so on). The first section concerns the performance statistics of rule runs. The second section concerns data operation metrics.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The charts in the Rules and decision tables section only include cases where rule conditions were met and consequences were executed. The charts describe the execution times of the consequences.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Indicative total execution time per rule

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The total execution time (in milliseconds) per rule run during the selected time period. If multiple rules or decision tables are triggered simultaneously for the same object, the total time spent on those rules is counted towards each individual rule run. For example, triggering five rules with 10 millisecond execution times for one object (contact, portfolio, security, transaction, or trade order) will result in a total execution time of 50 milliseconds for each rule.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Number of rule triggers

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The number of times a rule was triggered during the selected time period. This includes rules from decision tables and other types of rules, for example, rules generated with scripts.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Indicative average execution time per rule

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The average execution time (in milliseconds) per rule run during the selected time period. Long average execution times may indicate performance problems. If multiple rules or decision tables are triggered simultaneously for the same object (contact, portfolio, security, transaction, or trade order), the total time spent on those rules is counted towards each individual rule run. For example, five simultaneously triggered rules with 10 millisecond execution times will have average execution times of 50 milliseconds.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: Triggered rules per minute

title: Rules and decision tables
body: The time at which each rule was triggered, accurate to the minute. The chart shows a more detailed analysis of the number of rule triggers and lets you analyse their distribution over the selected time period.

title: Rules and decision tables
body: When you view Triggered rules per minute, you might need to zoom in on the chart to see the values clearly, especially in the case of large time scales.

title: Data modifications
body: Except for the Database latency, all charts show the values split by:

title: Data modifications
body: Data type (portfolio, transaction, trade order, and so on).

title: Data modifications
body: Operation type (create/update/delete portfolio, security, and so on). One data operation means an addition/modification/deletion of a single data row in FA. For example, creating a new transaction in FA results in two operations: a transaction creation operation, and a separate transactionVO creation operation.

title: Data modifications
body: As the chart lines are quite narrow, values might not show up until you zoom in a bit, especially on a bigger scale.

title: Data modifications
body: Average data change latency per data type

title: Data modifications
body: The average time (in milliseconds) per data operation, broken down by data type. Spikes on this chart may indicate a (temporary) performance bottleneck.

title: Data modifications
body: Average data change latency per data type and operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by data type and operation type.

title: Data modifications
body: Time spent on data operations

title: Data modifications
body: Total amount of time spent on various data operations during a given time window (1-2 minutes), broken down per data type. Spikes on this chart indicate that extensive data modification took place at a given point in time; it does not automatically indicate slowness.

title: Data modifications
body: Time spent on data operations per operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by data type.

title: Data modifications
body: Data changes per minute

title: Data modifications
body: The number of objects created/modified/deleted during a given 1-minute time window. Due to technical reasons, the numbers might not be fully accurate, especially with smaller modification counts, but close to it. Spikes on this chart are not directly indicative of the performance, they indicate extensive data modification taking place.

title: Data modifications
body: Data changes per minute per operation type

title: Data modifications
body: Same as above, broken down by operation type.

title: Data modifications
body: Database latency

title: Data modifications
body: The database response time. The values on the chart should normally stay under 1 millisecond. Values that permanently exceed this limit indicate a potential problem in the technical setup. Spikes in these values may indicate performance problems.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 1 po.extId No No. External ID of the posting. Used when updating an existing posting. If left empty, the system generates a running number as an ID.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 2 po.status Yes Status Posting status: ReadyNot finishedDeletedReported

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 3 po.parentPortfolio Yes Portfolio ID Text or number uniquely identifying a portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 4 po.postingDate Yes Posting date Date formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 5 po.effectiveDate No Effective date Date formatted as yyyy-MM-dd.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 6 po.accountNumber Yes Account number Bookkeeping account number.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 7 po.accountSetName Yes Account set Account set name.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 8 po.amount Yes Amount Posting amount: positive number for credit, negative for debit.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 9 po.reference No Posting reference. Free text, allowing you to fill in additional details on your postings.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 10 po.memo No Memo Posting memo. Free text, allowing you to fill in additional details on your postings.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 11 po.transactionExtId No External ID External ID of the linked transaction. If you provide this ID, the bank account number and security code are fetched from the transaction (do not fill them in).

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 12 po.bankAccountNumber No Bank account no. The number of a bank account linked to the portfolio.

title: FA Format for importing postings
body: 13 po.securityCode No Security code The code of the security this posting is related to.

title: Available charge types
body: Charge type Description

title: Available charge types
body: Price Corresponds with the calculated price shown in the transaction window, e.g. amount * unit price.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (no cost) Takes into account the purchase price, without costs, associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total tax Corresponds with the sum of the values in the tax fields of the transaction, e.g. tax 1 and tax 2 together.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest Corresponds with the value in the Accrued interest field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Total price Corresponds with the total trade amount of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Credit fee Corresponds with the value in the Credit fee field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Fee Corresponds with the value in the Fee field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price Takes into account the purchase price associated with the transaction. If booked values are defined, then those are taken into account.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss Takes into account the loss induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit Takes into account the profit induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Currency loss Takes into account the currency loss induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Currency profit Takes into account the currency profit induced by the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Loss (no cost) Takes into account the loss, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Profit (no cost) Takes into account the profit, calculated without taking into account costs, induced by the transaction (calculated from booked values if they have been defined).

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 1 Corresponds with the value in the Tax 1 field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Tax 2 Corresponds with the value in the Tax 2 field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Purchase price (orig.) Takes into account the original purchase price associated with the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Accrued interest (purch.) Takes into account the accrued interest associated with the purchase transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Nominal value Corresponds with the amount field of the transaction.

title: Available charge types
body: Tax types See a list of tax types defined in Taxation preferences. This type takes into account the sum of values of the tax fields with the checked tax type.
